metadata.dc:author: Vargas-Hernández, V M
metadata.dc:description: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) is the most common infection among women. Natural History of HPV infection has changed as well as diagnosis and treatment. Clinical picture is variable even with spontaneous remission. Molecular Biology for diagnosis and typification of HPV has changed its treatment. The disease can be treated according to clinical experience. Sometimes can not eradicated since just it is impossible make to disappear it from genital tract.
metadata.dc:title: Virus del papiloma humano. Aspectos epidemiológicos, carcinogenéticos, diagnósticos y terapéuticos.
[Human Papilloma virus. Epidemiologic, carcinogenic, diagnostic and therapeutic aspects].
